content: On September 28, 1993, the Atlanta Braves clinched the National League West title, marking their second consecutive division championship. The Braves secured the title with a 6-4 victory over the Colorado Rockies, thanks in part to a crucial home run by David Justice. This win was a pivotal moment in the Braves' dominance of the National League during the 1990s, setting the stage for their postseason run that year, which ultimately led to an appearance in the World Series.
